intro: Anemone kostyczewii, commonly known as the Kosticean anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant features showy, pink to white flowers with numerous petals and a distinctive yellow center. Its leaves are palmately divided, typically with five to seven lobes, and are covered in a fine layer of hairs. Anemone kostyczewii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
